definition: victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: They have vulgarized many of the loveliest spots in our country.
sentences.chinese: 他们把我国许多最美的旅游胜地弄得庸俗不堪。

sentences.english: There are also horse-driven carriages, especially in Chinatown and other touristy places.
sentences.chinese: 除此以外还有马车，特别是在唐人街和其他旅游胜地。

sentences.english: Qingdao is a prime tourist  destination, with a beer  festival and a yacht culture.
sentences.chinese: 青岛是个旅游胜地，有著名的啤酒节和快艇文化。

sentences.english: They are quite common and a popular tourist attraction on the island of Tasmania.
sentences.chinese: 它们是塔斯马尼亚岛上普通但吸引人的旅游胜地。

sentences.english: In the past few years, some of these monuments have become billboards.
sentences.chinese: 过去的几年，一些旅游胜地俨然成为宣传的广告牌。

sentences.english: Davao Islands is much oner all sides is a high-quality sandy beach, can develop seashore tour divine spot.
sentences.chinese: 海南岛四周多为优质沙滩，可开发成海滨旅游胜地。

sentences.english: Noted as a resort, it was the site of the 1936 Winter Olympics. Population, 28,049.
sentences.chinese: 作为旅游胜地而著名，1936年冬奥会于此举行。

sentences.english: Langzhong had already been a famous scenic area nationwide in the Tang and Song Dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 唐宋时期，阆中已是全国著名的旅游胜地。

sentences.english: Soneva Fushi, for instance, will become the world's first carbon-neutral tourist resort.
sentences.chinese: 例如富士公司，将成为世界上第一个碳中性旅游胜地。

sentences.english: So very long ago, the Lishan Mountain was a already famous resort.
sentences.chinese: 骊山很早以前就是著名的旅游胜地了。

sentences.english: It's a really big tourist spot.
sentences.chinese: 它可真是个旅游胜地呢。

sentences.english: Hong Kong is a top-20 most visited vacation spot by Americans.
sentences.chinese: 香港是一个前20名的旅游胜地美国人点。

sentences.english: The place has developed from a fishing port into a tourist centre.
sentences.chinese: 这地方由原来的渔港发展成一个旅游胜地。

sentences.english: Madeleine vanished from an apartment in the Portuguese resort of Praia da Luz two weeks ago.
sentences.chinese: 马德琳两周前从葡萄牙旅游胜地的一间旅馆突然失踪。

sentences.english: Today, it is an immensely popular tourist attraction.
sentences.chinese: 今天，天涯海角是极受欢迎的旅游胜地。

sentences.english: Hongkong is the tourist attraction in the world, praised as the sightseer's paradise.
sentences.chinese: 香港是世界向往的旅游胜地，被誉为观光者的乐园。

definition: a hot tourist attraction/a tourist trap
a place famous for its scenery or historical relics/scenic spot/CL:處|处[chu4]
heaven on Earth/nickname for the city Suzhou
places of historic interest/historical sites/CL:個|个[ge4]
lit. verdant hills and limpid water (idiom)/fig. enchanting scenery
holy land (of a religion)/sacred place/shrine/holy city (such as Jerusalem, Mecca etc)/center of historic interest
